author: Cheng Lim, Bryony Evans
title: King & Wood Mallesons says cyber crime needs more than mere reporting to beat ransomware attacks - The Australian Financial Review
description: The government wants big businesses to report ransomware incidents, but it should also consider banning them from paying ransoms.
content: As a matter of principle, many are sympathetic to the view give in to the criminal and you breed more criminals. It is a vexed question, and even the experts cant agree if this is better or not many … [+2323 chars]
source.name: Australian Financial Review

author: Andrew Tillett
title: Critical infrastructure facing cyber security risks - The Australian Financial Review
description: There has been a big increase in ransomware and cyber crime incidents and the government is keen to protect critical infrastructure.
content:
Certainly criminals are getting much more sophisticated in their attacks, but in many ways the ease of conducting a cyber attack is significantly greater than the importation of drugs.

author: James Eyers
title: CreditWatch founder Colin Porter returns to stop invoice scams costing businesses more than $100m
description: A fintech start-up has banked investment, as it looks to use open banking stop the kind of business email compromise scams, that brought down Levitas Capital.
content:
Despite the scale of the problem, Mr Porter said the crime often went unreported.
This is because it is an embarrassment for companies when they make the fraudulent payment, Mr Porter said.
